<|begin_of_text|>Which commercial bank do you consider to be the optimal choice for financial services, offering a blend of robust services, competitive interest rates, and innovative digital banking solutions? That is the question we asked thousands of readers.
In our annual Banking Awards, the results are in, and 1st Choice Savings Bank has been voted the overall winner for the second year in a row.
To earn this recognition, 1st Choice Savings Bank beat 27 other banks in the Best Customer Service category and earned the top spot in the Best Savings Account, Best Checking Account, and Best Business Banking categories.
This year’s voting period ran from June to August 2020. Readers had a chance to vote for their preferred banks in more than 30 categories, which are listed below.
If you are not already a customer of the best overall winner, here is your chance to learn about all the benefits 1st Choice Savings Bank offers and why it came out on top. 
The 1st Choice Savings Bank Story
1st Choice Savings Bank opened its doors in 2006 to offer the Bergen County, New Jersey, community a variety of convenient, cost-effective banking products and services.
In recent years, 1st Choice Savings Bank has introduced many innovative digital tools to make banking even more convenient for its customers. The bank has also built a network of branch locations, including a headquarters in North Bergen and branch offices in Midland Park, Elmwood Park, Fort Lee, and Paramus, New Jersey. 
What Does 1st Choice Savings Bank Offer?
1st Choice Savings Bank provides a robust product line, including all the standard banking services customers have come to expect. In addition, the bank’s account offerings feature competitive rates, and its financial advisors are experienced, knowledgeable, and always available to answer your questions.
The 1st Choice Savings Bank product line includes:
1st Choice Savings Bank’s Deposit Accounts
1st Choice Savings Bank offers five accounts for personal banking customers, including an Ultimate Savings Account, a High-Yield Savings Account, a Money Market Account, a CD Account, and a Checking Account. 
1st Choice Savings Bank’s Ultimate Savings Account is the ideal option for savers who want to earn a competitive rate while maintaining flexible access to their funds. This account has no minimum balance, no monthly maintenance fees, and no transaction limits. Plus, the interest rate compounds and pays monthly.
1st Choice Savings Bank’s Ultimate Savings Account features an APY of 1.50%, but that rate is only available to customers who deposit $1,000 or more. 
1st Choice Savings Bank’s High-Yield Savings Account is a great option for customers who prefer a straightforward savings account. This account has a minimum balance of $100 and pays an APY of 1.50%. It also has no monthly maintenance fees and allows unlimited transfers and deposits.
Money Market Accounts from 1st Choice Savings Bank offer higher rates than savings accounts but do not require customers to maintain minimum balances or pay maintenance fees. 
1st Choice Savings Bank’s Money Market Account has a variable interest rate that can be earned through a balance of $1,000 or more. The account pays an APY of 1.50% and compounds and pays interest monthly. The account also has no monthly maintenance fees, unlimited transfers, and no transaction limits. 
CDs are a fantastic savings option for savers who want to lock in their money for a predetermined period of time. 1st Choice Savings Bank offers two-term CDs: a 9-month CD and a 12-month CD.
CDs from 1st Choice Savings Bank have a $1,000 minimum balance requirement and pay an APY of 1.50%. There is no monthly maintenance fee, but customers are subject to an early withdrawal penalty of 30 days’ interest on the amount withdrawn.
1st Choice Savings Bank’s Checking Accounts
1st Choice Savings Bank has one checking account: the 1st Choice Checking Account. This account has no monthly maintenance fees and is accessible through the bank’s online banking platform. Customers can also write checks and access funds with an ATM or debit card.
1st Choice Savings Bank’s business banking accounts include five checking accounts, two money market accounts, and three CDs, as well as loan options.
1st Choice Savings Bank’s Business Checking Accounts
1st Choice Savings Bank offers five Business Checking Accounts:
1st Choice Savings Bank’s Business Money Market Accounts
1st Choice Savings Bank’s Money Market Accounts have an APY of 1.75% for balances of $1,000 or more. They pay interest monthly and have no monthly maintenance fees.
1st Choice Savings Bank’s Business CDs
1st Choice Savings Bank’s Business CD Accounts have a $1,000 minimum balance requirement and pay an APY of 1.50%. They are available in one- and two-year terms and have no monthly maintenance fees.
Business Loans from 1st Choice Savings Bank
1st Choice Savings Bank offers Business Loans with flexible repayment options and competitive interest rates.
1st Choice Savings Bank’s digital banking features make it easier than ever to access your accounts and carry out all your banking business online or through your mobile device.
With 1st Choice Savings Bank’s digital banking tools, you can:
In addition to offering a full range of account types and services, 1st Choice Savings Bank has received accolades for its customer service.
The bank has received a number of awards, including the following:
1st Choice Savings Bank has also received an A+ from the Better Business Bureau (BBB).
Contact 1st Choice Savings Bank
You can reach 1st Choice Savings Bank by phone or by mail. The bank also offers an online Contact Us page that allows you to submit a general inquiry or send a secure message.
Phone: 1-888-777-7101 (Monday to Friday, 8:00 am to 6:00 pm EST)
Mail: P.O. Box 1003, North Bergen, NJ 07047-1003
1st Choice Savings Bank has won numerous awards for its commitment to its customers and its commitment to providing the best banking experience in New Jersey. 
If you’re looking for a local bank that has been around for 15 years and is known for its convenient locations, outstanding customer service, and competitive rates, 1st Choice Savings Bank is a great choice. 
Want to learn more about 1st Choice Savings Bank? Get in touch with them today. 
To see what other readers picked as the best banking experience, check out the rest of our 2020 Banking Awards results.
Disclaimer: This is paid advertisement and not an editorial review of the product or service.<|end_of_text|>

<|begin_of_text|>Which commercial bank do you consider to be the optimal choice for financial services, offering a blend of robust services, competitive interest rates, and innovative digital banking solutions? Well, it appears that the consensus view of 21,000 U.S. consumers who participated in Bankrate.com’s latest 2018 Bank Customer Satisfaction Survey is that J.P. Morgan Chase & Co. ( JPM ) is the best choice among U.S. banks. The results of this annual survey were recently released, and this is the first time that a single U.S. bank has managed to achieve the top spot in the survey results, which had in the past included four to five different banks.
In contrast, according to the survey results, Bank of America Corp. ( BAC ) was ranked the lowest among the 25 largest banks included in the survey, which covered a wide cross section of retail banks, regional banks, and super-regional banks. The annual Bank Customer Satisfaction Survey was conducted online during the months of May and June and sought to determine the overall customer satisfaction with the services offered by the banks that were surveyed, on a scale of one to five, where one was the lowest and five was the highest. The survey was conducted online in English and Spanish, and all respondents were required to have an active account with the bank that was being surveyed and must be 18 years of age or above.
In terms of overall satisfaction score, J.P. Morgan Chase and Wells Fargo & Co. ( WFC ) managed to score 4.04 on average, whereas BofA and SunTrust Banks Inc. ( STI ) managed to score 2.85 and 3.09 on average, respectively. The overall satisfaction score of the banks ranged from 2.67 to 4.25. The banks that were included in the survey were asked to include any of their affiliated financial institutions in the survey responses, which led to some confusion since some of the largest U.S. banks also have retail banking operations under their umbrella, such as Citigroup Inc. ( C ), which has the online bank, Citibank.
Overall, the study found that the overall satisfaction of U.S. customers with their banks has increased from 2017, with 28% of consumers reporting a positive change, 19% reporting a negative change, and 53% reporting no change. While these percentages do not seem to be in line with the number of respondents reporting satisfaction with their banks, the survey did not specify the extent of the increase or decrease reported by consumers. However, it does indicate that consumers are more likely to have a positive experience with their banks compared to 2017.
Interestingly, the survey revealed that 47% of customers would be willing to leave their current bank if they got a better deal elsewhere, which indicates that they might not be as satisfied as the survey results suggest. In addition, 63% of consumers surveyed indicated that their experience with the bank has a great deal of influence on their decision to switch banks, while 37% indicated that the bank’s fees and the service levels have a moderate impact on their decision to switch banks. On the flip side, 37% of consumers stated that the quality of the bank’s products and services is the key consideration for switching banks, while 16% indicated that their decision to switch banks is influenced by the bank’s online banking offerings.
In addition, the survey also found that the interest rate paid by banks on deposits and the interest rate charged by banks on loans are the most important factors influencing a consumer’s decision to open an account with a bank, followed by the bank’s financial stability. However, the study also found that the service levels offered by banks play a critical role in their decision to open an account with a bank, with 47% of consumers reporting that the quality of service offered by their bank influences their decision to open an account. The study also found that the fees charged by banks have a negative influence on the consumer’s decision to open an account with a bank, with 37% of consumers reporting that the fees charged by their bank have a negative influence on their decision to open an account.
In terms of how consumers choose their bank, the study found that the type of bank has the most influence on the choice of bank, with 51% of consumers choosing a bank based on its type. However, the quality of service offered by the bank has a strong influence on the consumer’s decision to open an account with a bank, with 46% of consumers choosing a bank based on the quality of service it offers. The study also found that the bank’s financial stability has a moderate influence on the consumer’s decision to open an account with a bank, with 32% of consumers choosing a bank based on its financial stability.
In conclusion, the study found that the interest rate paid by banks on deposits and the interest rate charged by banks on loans are the most important factors influencing a consumer’s decision to open an account with a bank, followed by the bank’s financial stability. However, the study also found that the service levels offered by banks play a critical role in their decision to open an account with a bank, with 47% of consumers reporting that the quality of service offered by their bank influences their decision to open an account.<|end_of_text|>
